newsitem.title: FRANCE: Axa says 500 mln 98 savings estimate prudent.
newsitem.headline: Axa says 500 mln 98 savings estimate prudent.

text.p: Axa chairman Claude Bebear said on Tuesday that an estimate of 500 million francs in 1998 savings from a merger with UAP would be "prudent" and that one billion savings in 1999 was likewise a prudent estimate.

Bebear was explaining a table based on analysts' forecasts which showed that 500 million francs of savings in 1998 would produce a 24 percent rise in earnings per share for UAP and a rise of eight percent on Axa earnings per share.
The same table showed that a billion francs of savings in 1999 would produce a 28 percent increase in earnings per share for UAP shareholders and a 12 percent increase for Axa shareholders.
